Delhi: 
Delhi is a city which is a bridge of two different worlds. Old Delhi , which was the capital of Islamic India, s a labyrinth of narrow lanes lined with crumbling havelis and formidable mosques. In short , the city of Delhi was created by British ruler is composed of spacious, tree-lined avenues and government buildings. Delhi is the place of several rulers and many empires for about a millennium. Many times the city was destroyed and rebuilt. 

Places to visit in Delhi : 
Akshardham Temple: Akshardham Temple is the shrine of Lord Swaminarayan which is situated in the east region of New Delhi, located on the banks of River Yamuna. 
Chandni Chowk: Chandni Chowk is the main market area which is known for its antiquity which is rendered in a enerated place in the markets of Delhi. It is has been told that Chandni Chowk was lined up with beautiful fountains. 

Old Delhi: Old Delhi which was called as the city of Shahjahanabad. Old Delhi was established by Shah Jahan and it was made as a capital. Old Delhi has a long and interesting history which is heard even today, the remains of the glory of the past can be found in the form of Kashmiri Gate, Ajmeri Gate, Turkman Gate, Delhi Gate and Feroz Shah Kotla. 

.India Gate: India Gate is the war memorial arch which was by British rulers in the honor of the brave soldiers who have their lives in first world war and second Afghan War.

From Delhi the distance of Manali is about 550Km, it is connected by bus passing the town with Delhi, Shimla, Dharamsala and Leh. Bus tickets from Delhi to Manali can be made in Inter State Bus Terminus as well as at the Himachal Tourism office on Safdar Hashmi Marg near Mandi House in New Delhi. The travel time from Delhi to Manali is 14 hours. Volvo buses, depart at around 5PM and reach at 09-10 AM next day-are available from Delhi. Bus from Delhi is the best option in terms of comfort and safety, it is a value of money to reach Manali, you need to book your bus tickets in advance.
